You just have to grab two sources and generate two data streams, robotpy, wpilibs java and cpp libraries and basic opencv will support this

# opencv read images from camera
# and display

import cv2
import time

# open camera
cap = cv2.VideoCapture(0)
cap2 = cv2.VideoCapture(1)

# display camera feed
while True:
    ret, frame = cap.read()
    cv2.imshow('frame', frame)

    # use cap2 here I only have one camera to demo
    ret, frame = cap.read()
    cv2.imshow('frame2', frame)
    if cv2.waitKey(1) & 0xFF == ord('q'):
        break

Screenshot from 2023-02-23 12-29-071373×1072 60.7 KB

from the cap & cap2 you can either display, save, or stream out the videos

Are you using the WPILibPi image? If so, you can start from the Python example it includes and follow the RobotPy-cscore documentation for image processing (or if you aren’t just use RobotPy-cscore directly). Custom Image processing — RobotPy 2023 documentation

CS: WARNING: USB Camera 1: could not set format 1 res 320x240 (UsbCameraImpl.cpp:973)

CS: ERROR: ioctl VIDIOC_G_PARM failed at UsbCameraImpl.cpp:990: Inappropriate ioctl for device (UsbUtil.cpp:156)

CS: ERROR: ioctl VIDIOC_REQBUFS failed at UsbCameraImpl.cpp:654: Invalid argument (UsbUtil.cpp:156)

Someone knows what’s the problem?

What USB cameras are you using? You can use v4l2-utils to get more information; what does v4l2-ctl -d 1 —list-formats say?

Each camera separately is working fine.
But when I’m trying to capture both cameras in parallel I got this error…

","post_number":13,"post_type":1,"posts_count":23,"updated_at":"2023-02-23T20:06:46.032Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":12,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":4,"reads":42,"readers_count":41,"score":33.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":427835,"topic_slug":"connect-two-cameras-to-raspberry-pi","display_username":"Sahar","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":13575,"username":"Peter_Johnson","name":"Peter Johnson","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/peter_johnson/{size}/10417_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":57388,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/connect-two-cameras-to-raspberry-pi/427835/13","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3151425,"name":"Peter Johnson","username":"Peter_Johnson","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/peter_johnson/{size}/10417_2.png","created_at":"2023-02-23T20:19:40.438Z","cooked":"

Sometimes one camera will create two video devices, so the “second” camera may actually be trying to connect to the second device of the first camera. E.g. the first camera appears as both /dev/video0 and /dev/video1, and you’re trying to connect to devices 0 and 1. How are you specifying the video devices to capture (device number, path?)? What does v4l2-ctl --list-dev output?

","post_number":14,"post_type":1,"posts_count":23,"updated_at":"2023-02-23T20:21:01.116Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":13,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":8,"reads":41,"readers_count":40,"score":48.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":427835,"topic_slug":"connect-two-cameras-to-raspberry-pi","display_username":"Peter Johnson","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":57388,"username":"SaharDev","name":"Sahar","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/s/6f9a4e/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":13575,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Volunteer WPILib Developer, CSA"},"post_url":"/t/connect-two-cameras-to-raspberry-pi/427835/14","custom_user_title":"Volunteer WPILib Developer, CSA","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3151431,"name":"Sahar","username":"SaharDev","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/s/6f9a4e/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-02-23T20:24:14.288Z","cooked":"

v4l2-ctl --list-dev
bcm2835-codec-decode (platform:bcm2835-codec):
/dev/video10
/dev/video11
/dev/video12
/dev/video18
/dev/video31
/dev/media3

bcm2835-isp (platform:bcm2835-isp):
/dev/video13
/dev/video14
/dev/video15
/dev/video16
/dev/video20
/dev/video21
/dev/video22
/dev/video23
/dev/media1
/dev/media2

rpivid (platform:rpivid):
/dev/video19
/dev/media0

HD Camera (usb-0000:01:00.0-1.3):
/dev/video0
/dev/video1
/dev/media4

Microsoft® LifeCam HD-3000: Mi (usb-0000:01:00.0-1.4):
/dev/video2
/dev/video3
/dev/media5

pi@wpilibpi(rw):~ ^C pi@wpilibpi(rw):~
pi@wpilibpi(rw):~$ v4l2-ctl --list-dev
bcm2835-codec-decode (platform:bcm2835-codec):
/dev/video10
/dev/video11
/dev/video12
/dev/video18
/dev/video31
/dev/media3

bcm2835-isp (platform:bcm2835-isp):
/dev/video13
/dev/video14
/dev/video15
/dev/video16
/dev/video20
/dev/video21
/dev/video22
/dev/video23
/dev/media1
/dev/media2

rpivid (platform:rpivid):
/dev/video19

this is the output.

","post_number":15,"post_type":1,"posts_count":23,"updated_at":"2023-02-23T20:24:14.288Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":8,"reads":41,"readers_count":40,"score":53.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":427835,"topic_slug":"connect-two-cameras-to-raspberry-pi","display_username":"Sahar","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":57388,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/connect-two-cameras-to-raspberry-pi/427835/15","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3151432,"name":"Peter Johnson","username":"Peter_Johnson","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/peter_johnson/{size}/10417_2.png","created_at":"2023-02-23T20:24:58.862Z","cooked":"

Yep, that’s exactly what’s happening, see:

HD Camera (usb-0000:01:00.0-1.3):
/dev/video0
/dev/video1
/dev/media4

and

Microsoft® LifeCam HD-3000: Mi (usb-0000:01:00.0-1.4):
/dev/video2
/dev/video3
/dev/media5

So you need to be connecting to devices 0 and 2, not devices 0 and 1.

","post_number":19,"post_type":1,"posts_count":23,"updated_at":"2023-02-23T20:46:29.927Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":18,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":31,"readers_count":30,"score":16.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":427835,"topic_slug":"connect-two-cameras-to-raspberry-pi","display_username":"Peter Johnson","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":57388,"username":"SaharDev","name":"Sahar","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/s/6f9a4e/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":13575,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Volunteer WPILib Developer, CSA"},"post_url":"/t/connect-two-cameras-to-raspberry-pi/427835/19","custom_user_title":"Volunteer WPILib Developer, CSA","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3151448,"name":"Sahar","username":"SaharDev","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/s/6f9a4e/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-02-23T20:49:55.505Z","cooked":"

The source code: (python)

CameraServer.startAutomaticCapture()

#input_stream_feeder = CameraServer.getVideo("feeder")
input_stream_feeder = cv2.VideoCapture(0)
output_stream_feeder = CameraServer.putVideo('ProcessedFeeder', 640, 480)

#input_stream_arm = CameraServer.getVideo("arm")
input_stream_arm = cv2.VideoCapture(2)
output_stream_arm = CameraServer.putVideo('ProcessedArm', 640, 480)

img = np.zeros(shape=(640, 480, 3), dtype=np.uint8)
imgArm = np.zeros(shape=(640, 480, 3), dtype=np.uint8)
time.sleep(0.5)

#Pub = 0
# cap = cv2.VideoCapture(0)

while True:

    
    # Feeder Code: 
    #frame_time, input_img_feeder = input_stream_feeder.grabFrame(img)
    frame_time, input_img_feeder = input_stream_feeder.read()
    priority = Sub_priority.get()
    properties = (0.0 ,0.0)
    if(priority == 0):
        continue
    
    if(priority == 1):
        properties = find_cone(input_img_feeder)

        # didn't found cone
        if(properties == (0,0)):
            properties = find_cube(input_img_feeder)
    
    if(priority == 2):
        properties = find_cube(input_img_feeder)

        # didn't found cube
        if(properties == (0,0)):
            properties = find_cone(input_img_feeder)

    # Feeder      
    Pub_angle_feeder.set(properties[0])
    Pub_distance_feeder.set(properties[1])




    # Arm Code:
    #frame_time2, input_img_arm = input_stream_arm.grabFrame(imgArm)
    frame_time2, input_img_arm = input_stream_arm.read()
    priority = Sub_priority.get()
    properties = (0 ,0, 0)
    if(priority == 0):
        continue
    
    if(priority == 1):
        properties = direction_cone(input_img_arm)

        # didn't found cone
        if(properties == (0, 0)):
            properties = find_cube(input_img_feeder)
    
    if(priority == 2):
        properties = find_cube(input_img_feeder)

        # didn't found cube
        if(properties == (0,0)):
            properties = direction_cone(input_img_feeder)

    # Arm      
    Pub_angle_arm.set(properties[0])
    Pub_distance_arm.set(properties[1])
    if(len(properties) == 3):
        Pub_cone_angle.set(properties[2])


    output_img_feeder = np.copy(input_img_feeder)
    output_stream_feeder.putFrame(output_img_feeder)

    output_img_arm = np.copy(input_stream_arm)
    output_stream_arm.putFrame(output_img_arm)
    pass
","post_number":20,"post_type":1,"posts_count":23,"updated_at":"2023-02-23T20:49:55.505Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":19,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":20,"reads":30,"readers_count":29,"score":111.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":427835,"topic_slug":"connect-two-cameras-to-raspberry-pi","display_username":"Sahar","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":13575,"username":"Peter_Johnson","name":"Peter Johnson","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/peter_johnson/{size}/10417_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":57388,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/connect-two-cameras-to-raspberry-pi/427835/20","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3151451,"name":"Peter Johnson","username":"Peter_Johnson","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/peter_johnson/{size}/10417_2.png","created_at":"2023-02-23T20:57:00.815Z","cooked":"

Okay, you’re using opencv instead of cscore to access the cameras… actually you’re using both; CameraServer.startAutomaticCapture() also opens /dev/video0, which is what you’re also trying to do with cv2.VideoCapture(0), so the two are conflicting. I would recommend you just use cscore:

feeder_camera = CameraServer.startAutomaticCapture(name="feeder", dev=0)
feeder_camera.setResolution(640, 480)
input_stream_feeder = CameraServer.getVideo("feeder")
output_stream_feeder = CameraServer.putVideo('ProcessedFeeder', 640, 480)

arm_camera = CameraServer.startAutomaticCapture(name="arm", dev=2)
arm_camera.setResolution(640, 480)
input_stream_arm = CameraServer.getVideo("arm")
output_stream_arm = CameraServer.putVideo('ProcessedArm', 640, 480)

img = np.zeros(shape=(640, 480, 3), dtype=np.uint8)
imgArm = np.zeros(shape=(640, 480, 3), dtype=np.uint8)
time.sleep(0.5)

while True:

    # Feeder Code: 
    frame_time, input_img_feeder = input_stream_feeder.grabFrame(img)

    frame_time2, input_img_arm = input_stream_arm.grabFrame(imgArm)
